items.title: WVU Fires Neal Brown!
items.content_html:
Something that most West Virginia football fans have seen coming for the past few weeks has finally happened, Neal Brown has been fired.

Now, while I don’t want or like to see anyone lose their job I do think that this is best for the football team. His tenure has been mediocre at best. He has won the games he should have won and then lost the ones he should have lost also.

www.espn.com/college-f…
items.content_text:

Now, while I don’t want or like to see anyone lose their job I do think that this is best for the football team. His tenure has been mediocre at best. He has won the games he should have won and then lost the ones he should have lost also.

items.title: 25 Movies of Chrstmas!
items.content_html:
One of my favorite Christmas traditions is watching holiday movies. This year, I have decided to catalog the films I watch, provide a brief personal review, and rate each one. Here’s how it will work:

  • I will watch one movie each day for the next 25 days.
  • After viewing the movie, I will write a three to four-sentence summary of my thoughts.
  • I will indicate whether I have seen the movie before.
  • Finally, I will give the movie a rating of one to five stars.

Stay tuned for my first movie, Home Alone!
items.content_text:
One of my favorite Christmas traditions is watching holiday movies. This year, I have decided to catalog the films I watch, provide a brief personal review, and rate each one. Here’s how it will work:

- I will watch one movie each day for the next 25 days.
- After viewing the movie, I will write a three to four-sentence summary of my thoughts.
- I will indicate whether I have seen the movie before.
- Finally, I will give the movie a rating of one to five stars.

Stay tuned for my first movie, Home Alone!

items.content_html: A year ago today my Dad was diagnosed with stage 4 lung cancer. By the grace of God he is still with us today. Don’t give up faith and make every moment count because you never know when it’s going to be your last.

items.content_html: All of this news about Twitter and Reddit really make me feel better about my decision to move more toward the indie web!

items.content_html: Among some of the other things I keep coming back to is micro.blog. I absolutely love the concept and even though I could set this up on my own I don’t really want to spend my time doing that so it’s definitely worth the money for me! I am happy to support the indie web movement.

items.content_html: I think we are starting to see the importance of owning your content and not relying on only one way to put or consume that content. Of course, I am talking about the recent development at Twitter where they restricted certain 3rd party developers from using their API. Check this article from The Information for more details on the API issue. The issue here is how suddenly and without notice the API keys were restricted and as of today still no communication as to why. With the current state of Twitter can you say that you own your content, yes you can still get all your tweets but if anything I think it has proven that the unpredictability of Twitter the past few months I would not count that as owning my content.
items.content_text: I think we are starting to see the importance of owning your content and not relying on only one way to put or consume that content. Of course, I am talking about the recent development at Twitter where they restricted certain 3rd party developers from using their API. [Check this article from The Information for more details on the API issue.](https://www.theinformation.com/articles/musks-twitter-intentionally-suspended-tweet-bot-third-party-apps-messages-show?offer=m_50_musk_q12023&utm_content=article_push&utm_medium=organic&utm_campaign=AB_post&utm_term=AB_post) The issue here is how suddenly and without notice the API keys were restricted and as of today still no communication as to why. With the current state of Twitter can you say that you own your content, yes you can still get all your tweets but if anything I think it has proven that the unpredictability of Twitter the past few months I would not count that as owning my content.

items.content_html: I feel like the current Twitter API issue going on right now is a perfect example of why you should own your content and not put all your eggs in one basket. I truly feel sorry for the people whose lives depend on that API.
items.content_text: I feel like the current Twitter API issue going on right now is a perfect example of why you should own your content and not put all your eggs in one basket. I truly feel sorry for the people whose lives depend on that API.

items.content_html:
Why I am going to double down on micro.blog :

  1. They have already figured out some of the hard stuff
  2. Most of the stuff I don’t enjoy, managing servers, website code, etc they take care of
  3. The monthly cost is worth it for me to use my time to focus on other things

items.content_html:
After playing around with Tana today and I have some more thoughts about it. I really want to like it and I can see a place for it in the future but I do not think it is for me right now. The way I write my notes and how my process works it just does not work well with it.

This is not a knock on Tana at all I think it is done well and I see the advantages of it For others in the pkm space. I look forward to see where this goes in the future.
items.content_text:

This is not a knock on Tana at all I think it is done well and I see the advantages of it For others in the pkm space. I look forward to see where this goes in the future.

items.title: Soft Launch of Landing Page!
items.content_html:
Alright, Alright, I am pleased to say that I have finished with my basic landing page to collect info for potential web dev clients. It is not much right now but a massive win for me because up to this point I have had “plans” to get started and never did so just having this is a step, a small one but its a step forward nonetheless.

jasonawise.dev

items.content_html: It’s a surreal feeling the night before Christmas because it’s moments like in the morning that I work so hard for during the year. To be able to see the joy of my family’s faces makes all of those long days and sleepless nights worth it.
